security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidelines. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands. Risk level: safe.

content.value_statement: Technical content often contains hidden barriers like gatekeeping language, undefined jargon, and mismatched reading levels. This skill systematically reviews content through a reasoning lens, identifying accessibility issues before learners encounter them.
actual_capabilities: Analyze content against 5-tier proficiency framework (A1 to B2+)
Detect gatekeeping language (obviously, simply, just, of course)
Identify undefined technical jargon in need of definition
Measure readability gaps against target audience level
Verify accessibility for visually impaired learners
Generate revision recommendations with concrete examples
limitations: Does not automatically edit or rewrite content
Does not integrate with external readability tools
Does not validate against specific style guides
Requires user to provide target proficiency level

use_cases.title: Documentation review
use_cases.description: Review API docs, tutorials, and reference material for learner accessibility before publication

use_cases.title: Educational content audit
use_cases.description: Validate instructional content matches intended difficulty tier and reading level

use_cases.title: Clarity assessment
use_cases.description: Identify and flag unclear passages, missing definitions, and comprehension barriers

prompt_templates.title: Quick clarity check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this [paragraph/section] for technical clarity. Target audience: [A2/B1/B2+] learners. Flag any gatekeeping language, undefined jargon, or accessibility issues.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete technical clarity audit on this [document/chapter]. Follow the 5-question framework: Audience Context, Readability Gap, Jargon Necessity, Completeness, Accessibility. Provide a score and specific revision suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Jargon analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this content for undefined technical terms. List each undefined term, where it appears, and a suggested definition appropriate for [A2/B1/B2+] learners.

prompt_templates.title: Gatekeeping scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan this content for gatekeeping language (obviously, simply, just, of course, trivially, everyone knows). List each occurrence with replacement suggestions that explain rather than minimize.

output_examples.input: Review this decorator explanation for B1 (intermediate) learners: 'Obviously, decorators are simple. Just wrap your function and you are done.'
output: CRITICAL: Core terms undefined ('decorator' and 'wrap' never defined)
IMPORTANT: Missing context - prerequisites not stated, no motivation given
Enhancement: Add concrete usage example before abstract explanation

best_practices: Always specify target proficiency level (A2/B1/B2+) before reviewing
Apply all 5 question sets systematically for complete analysis
Distinguish between necessary jargon (domain-specific) and unnecessary jargon
anti_patterns: Accepting 'obviously' or 'simply' as acceptable clarifying language
Skipping accessibility verification for code examples and formatting
Assuming B2+ learners do not need any scaffolding or definitions

faq.question: What proficiency levels does this skill support?
faq.answer: A1 (beginner), A2 (elementary), B1 (intermediate), B2 (upper-intermediate), and C1 (advanced). Specify target level in prompts.

faq.question: Does this skill edit my content automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill identifies issues and provides revision suggestions. You apply the changes yourself.

faq.question: Can I use this with other skills in a workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Works well with learning-objectives, code-example-generator, and book-scaffolding for comprehensive content quality.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files or send data externally?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure prompt-based skill with no network, file system, or code execution capabilities.

faq.question: What reading level targets should I use?
faq.answer: A2: Grade 6-8, B1: Grade 9-12, B2+: Grade 13+. Match to your learner's background.

faq.question: How is this different from grammar checkers?
faq.answer: Grammar checkers fix sentence structure. This skill identifies comprehension barriers, gatekeeping language, and accessibility issues that grammar tools miss.
